intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis githaginea, commonly known as the Githaginea orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate floral structures. The plant typically produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow, which bloom during the warmer months. Its roots are epiphytic, allowing it to grow on trees without requiring soil. This orchid thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining substrates for optimal growth.
